Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: kr1sty18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located in Gothic quarter. They were able to check us in early which was an added plus but be aware the rooms are hot! (February travel and indoor facing room, they were only running heat) It made it almost unbearable. Ask up front if the heat is on and if so ask for a room facing outside. Beds are VERY firm. I'm OK with firm beds but these were almost like rocks. Rooms are very small compared to US standards but was clean and had FOX in English! Nice market across the street to grab drinks and water. Did not pay for breakfast because the market was so much fun! Fresh fruit, smoothies, and baked goods... doesn't get much better than that. If we were to return I would would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “avinyo hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: room 603: top floor, completely renovated, with private terrasse, quite=> excellent value hotel ideally central located in gothic neighborhood. i would recommend it to family and friends. "....".......

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Eagles_Business
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 35 from Australia to Barcelona for the Mobile World Congress and we all stayed at the Catalonia Avinyo hotel. Mayka and her team were outstanding and made sure we were very well looked after with information, bookings for events and answers to any questions we had. The hotel is brilliantly placed in Carrer Avinyo with all of the Gothic Quarter an easy walk away - could not have been better. The rooms are smallish by Australian standards but well presented and were kept very clean. I can only rate the value as average because the room costs were high due the the Mobile World Congress during the week.I think at any other time it woulds be a great value hotel to stay in. Some of the rooms are a tad noisy at night, but that's a small price to pay for being in the centre of the action in Barcelona. I reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: BigCod
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a central location. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent. Rooms were clean and modern. The only really bad thing was noise from the street and other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location for las ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Katypeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in may and this is a little gem tucked away just round the corner to las ramblas. Staff were lovely and the room was spot on for the price. We had one excellent days weather and one dull so we tool advantage of the hot tub on the roof on the not so good day. Would definitely return had a fantastic time :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Otagopete
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 nights in Barcelona, took the airport bus into town and short walk through the old town to the Hotel.... The Check was painless and staff were friendly... The room was clean and roomy ... the color scheme was different was nice change from the boring multinational hotel rooms... The hotel is in a great location and short walks to Las Ramblas and harbor... close to metro and shops... Love the swim pool and roof top... to escape the heat.... I would stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: geromer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for four nights while in Barcelona. The hotel location is good and is very close to Las Ramblas without being on Las Ramblas. It is also close to the Gothic Quarter which has the Picasso Museum, Barcelona Cathedral, etc. Plus you can get the metro from the stations in Las Ramblas. The hotel has recently been renovated and you can tell. The rooms are modern and clean. We also had a room with no outside windows but only one to the inside hallway. We asked the front desk and they offered to move us but warned that the outside facing windows can be very loud at night so we stayed where we were. The only issue is that the heater was on for the hotel and so it got hot in the room and we had to open the window to the hall and actually bought a fan for the room. The staff was very nice and helpful the whole time. They helped with directions, the open bus tours, etc. They were very friendly the entire time. One more thing to note, the street that this is located on is very old and very small. Cabs are not allowed to go down the street after dark but it is not a far walk from the nearest large street. And I felt safe the whole time, even walking back late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the mid of the old Gotic Barri”
Reviews.Author: Ducadisiena
Reviews.Content: Fine place in the mid of the old town. Clean but a little bit rusty, meaning with this that something is old and not all equipments are updated or restored to a perfect status. Good choices for breakfast. Some rooms, amongst which mine, only have a corridor window not allowing you to see the sky and/or appreciate the weather or change the room air.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: nina d
Reviews.Content: The room 202 had no windows and a horrible smell. I went back to reception and they managed to give us a different room,although it seemed they were more fed up than apologizing for giving an unacceptable room for a price of 172 Euros per night (without breakfast)! The other room was with a 'window' but looking out to the interior of the hotel. No daylight with still an unpleasant humid smell, uncomfortable beds with pillows that give you a nice neck pain in the morning. The room are small with no real cupboards, just open hangers and an airconditioning that you cannot turn off at night. The rooms have no character, plain, dark and oppressing. The hotel is well situated and the rooms are clean. Other than that I have nothing positive to say.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but price too high”
Reviews.Author: TerryWrist
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, about halfway between the Ramblas and the Placa de Sant Jaume. Metro (underground) station Jaime I is a short walk from the hotel. At booking, we asked for separate beds. The room did indeed have two separate beds, so no problems there. Beds were very hard, but after numerous experiences of the same in Spain, I think this is the norm over there. However, the "hardness" of the bed was easily fixed by using some of the pillows as an extra mattress. Front desk staff was friendly and spoke English quite well. Our room had an aircon unit, which could actually not be switched off. However, we did not find the a/c noise disturbing, nor was there excessive cold (or heat) coming from the unit. I found the room quite small for the price paid, and our rate did not include breakfast (which was expensive; however, a supermarket is just across the street so we got something from breakfast there). However, If the price is right, I would not mind returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Good combination”
Reviews.Author: Amethist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, the staff was friendly and is extremely well located near the Gotic Quarter and very close to the Ramblas (less than 2 minutes walking). Also, the subway is also very close. My room was very nice, it had three beds and it had a little balcony over the street. Breakfast was also very good. The hotel is near the nightlife of Barcelona so it can be a litle bit noisy. Also, the taxis can´t get there so you will need to drag your luggage to this place a few streets.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Alinta B
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Avinyo - I booked this hotel over the internet. The room (and ultimately rooms) shown to me were nothing like the room advertised. The rooms I was shown either didnt have a window, or had a window into a very dark central courtyard, and both were tiny and dark. The staff tried to rush me through re this, but ultimately I was sent to a sister hotel (Catalonia Portal de l'Angel, which was fabulous) and so did not stay at the Catlonia Avinyo. It is in the old district in quite a good location, but note that the taxis cant get there so you will need to wheel your luggage to this place. In summary, it looked clean and safe, and the location was quite good, but the rooms were tiny and (effectively) windowless.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: VeraBF
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location in the Gothic Quarter, close enough to walk to Pl. Catalunya. Modern hotel, basic facilities, modern concept. I stayed in a triple wish had 3 beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, nice for a quick trip to the city.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Spain for a week visiting family. We did a quick trip to Barcelona for one night. We found the hotel last minute and booked online for a great price. We checked in late with no problems. We had an interior room which was very nice avoiding the noise from the busy street. The room was clean and a decent size for the money. The bathroom was almost as big as the sleeping area. Bathroom was spotless and shower was great. Air conditioning to a little while to kick in but once it did we were very comfortable. Had no problems with the wi-fi. Staff was very nice and helpful. We got up early and checked out. The front desk let us leave our luggage and explore the city all day. This is not a fancy hotel. Not sure I would recommend it for a long stay in the city with lots of luggage but perfect for a couple of nights. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION-HEED WARNING!”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location for a sightseeing trip. We had read the reveiws of this hotel and in our opinion we found it a pleasent location to base yourself for seeing the sites. Our room did not have a window and this suited us as it reduced the outside noise of this very busy city. Beds were comfortable and the room big enough for our needs. The bathroom was large and kept spotless by the very efficent chamber maids. The reception staff were very helpful throughout our stay and greeted us every time we passed by reception. The air-condition was very good. A tip to all who stay here ask for an extra door swipe card as this card operates the electric supply to your room. By leaving this extra card connected in your room, the air-con remains on all day bringing you back to a very cool room. Avoid breakfast at the hotel currently charged at 15 euros per person. Their are many cafe's and eating places within meters walk from the hotel offering a good selection of food and drink at very resonable prices. Taxis taken from outside the hotel attract a supplement because of the location of the hotel. By walking the few minutes to the La Ramblas you can avoid this supplement. Taxis also attract a supplement after midnight,sundays and public holidays. WARNING-- Avoid walking alone at night in the narrow and dimly lit streets surrounding the hotel. Myself and the night porter witnessed a wallet snatch at 4am in the morning from the safety of the hotel foyer whilst having a cigarette. Three men and two women who all looked to be alone or couples distracted an american tourist looking for a street sign. Within seconds one approched him pretending to be drunk and fell heavily against him forcing him into a doorway. The other two women followed them into the doorway and pretened to help him. In the ensuing confusion the man pushed the victim to the ground and releived the gentleman of the wallet. The theif ran away into the distance whilst the other two men and women impided the american tourist chasing after him. The whole event was over in a matter of seconds. Those impeding the tourist quickly dissapeared into the narrow side streets leaving a dazed and robbed victim. The night porter invited the victim into the hotel to recover. He lost all his cash and passport. Be WARNED a great place to visit but be on your gaurd in the very early hours.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Colitas81
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, in the gothic area a few metres away from Ramblas. Hotel staff is very helpful. Just ask for a room with a balcony because other rooms only have windows looking onto the corridor !

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, though slightly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: l_ben88
Reviews.Content: Perfect location – just off La Rambla, short walk to the seaside,few mins from Liceu metro stop & close enough to walk to Pl. Catalunya. My mum and I spent three nights here in a decent sized twin room and found the hotel to be comfy, quiet and convenient. The rooms are kinda grey in décor and fit a minimalist theme – kinda cool, kinda odd. We had originally requested a room with a window or balcony after reading reviews about strange rooms without any windows! Unfortunately there were none available when we checked in, so stayed in one of these ‘window-less’ rooms (there WAS a window out to the common corridor – a bit strange, but didn’t bother us too much.) Changed to a windowed room the next day, without too much trouble. The room had a decent sized bathroom, extra pillows and blankets in the cupboard, enough room to comfortable store our bags, minibar fridge (in which we stored fresh food purchases), though no tea or coffee making facilities (not sure if this is common in European hotels?). As we were there in the peak of summer, the room was a bit stuffy – the air con didn’t seem to work too well, but it wasn’t too bad (we’re both used to extreme heat anyway) we tried to keep our second room key in the wall during the day while we were out to keep the room cool, though housekeeping must have removed the it and returned it to reception…I guess we should have considered the energy we were using up doing so. The reception staff were ok – they understood English fairly well, though didn’t go out of their way to assist us with our queries. The reception area had decent seating, with a couple of couches, table and chair and a small bar which was handy. The small pool and Jacuzzi on the roof was a nice touch, though always seemed to be super busy. Not sure if we would stay here again, the location was fantastic, though felt we overpaid a little (360 euro for 3 nights – room only basis).

Reviews.Title: “I would go back”
Reviews.Author: Jamsimsafc
Reviews.Content: Advantages - Good location, even if a bit dodgy at night. It is very well insulated, so you can sleep like a baby. Very very good breakfast! Disadvantages - The wi fi did not work, but there were a couple of laptops everyone could use.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, hotel a 3 star so don't expect perfection”
Reviews.Author: somersetsunlover
Reviews.Content: Just off the Ramblas and a 5 minute walk from the port area, this hotel is an ideal base for seeing Barcelona. You can get the train from the airport to Place Catalunya and wander down to the hotel in 15 minutes. On a busy side street with lots going on (even until the early hours!), this is a 3 star hotel with aspirations to be a cool budget hotel. Large reception with chaise longues, tables and a bar. Nice but small rooftop pool and jacuzzi. Rooms are OK on size as are the bathrooms. Good firm mattresses and open plan storage. Decent smellies in bathroom. Points to watch out for. If the air con doesn't work there and then in your bedroom, get it fixed immediately or change rooms. We spent two sweltering nights in our room (thank god it was one of 50% that had a window) until another became available with air con that worked. Our third and last night was great because we were able to sleep well. Large LG TVs in room with English news channels. Fridges in room so you can buy water, beer etc from the supermaret nearby and circumnavigate bar bill charges. Check-in and out from 12 noon. We ended up with a Room Only basis which turned out well - it was 10euros per head in the hotel for breakfast, but we spent 13 or 14euros per day on breakfast for 2 at the local cafes - enormous chocolate croissants or bikinis (toasted cheese sandwiches), large coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice and water. They are doing some improvements to the hotel, which is great as it does need some care - silicone in bathroom, slow runnin water in shower, walls bashed around by suitcases etc. But you have to balance this with the wonderful location. I wouldn't stay here again but I would recommend the hotel if you are just going for the sightseeing and need a base. It was our wedding anniversary celebration (without small children!) and I wish I'd paid 15% more and gone to a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and in the heart of the old town.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwichick0
Reviews.Content: This was our splurge hotel and it was worth every cent! The rooms were beautifully designed with attractive, minimalist furniture. Our room was very quiet and dimly lit, making it easy to have a siesta as the locals do. This might not suit people who want a view, however. Located right in the heart of the old town, most of what we wanted to see could be reached on foot. The staff were efficient, welcoming and spoke English well. The hotel breakfast buffet was a feast not to be missed and included a huge range of offerings to suit every guest. It was available from early to mid-morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JanRobinM
Reviews.Content: This is not a nice hotel. Fitst of all, the staff does not make a good impression at all. Bunch of lazy sleepy people. Second, the rooms are way too small (funny how they try to cover it up with 'space enhancing' so called art) and the beds way too hard and uncomfortable. Some rooms (50%) don't even have windows. There are a lot of junkies outside and inside you can hear you neighbours snork. Nice of you wan't to be agitated during your stay. DON'T STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, black mold in room”
Reviews.Author: Teeba1
Reviews.Content: Location is great, with walking distance to many places in town. Problem was the black mold in the shower and the dead bug on the wall. Remove the black mold and the rating goes up.

Reviews.Title: “Interior rooms are extremely hot, even when not hot outside”
Reviews.Author: beenaround31
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is clean, service is friendly, location is awesome, but I had trouble sleeping because the room was 25 celsius at night. The temperature outside in the day was only 20, at night, it's around 13. I complained, was ignored once, the second time they flipped the breaker off for the heater in the room (I had already turned it off from the termostat). They made sure I had opened the window to the corredor and advised me I leave the door propped open and told me "Sorry". The bathroom also smelled like sewer gas and I woke up each day with a headache. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I booked from a recommendation, and the hotel lived up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: kate_boulton
Reviews.Content: I was travelling solo, with only a Spanish phrase book. The staff picked that up with the first conversation, and went out of their way to make me feel comfortable, and helped me with the internet, as they also worked out that I was new to that as well. I had packed my ear plugs, however I didn't need them at all, the room was so quiet, and so well set up. For a senior person travelling, the hotel is in an excellent position, so you are able to get your bearings quite quickly. I only have one regret, that I didn't take a photo of the outside of the hotel to show friends what it was like.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, clean, great location for tourist”
Reviews.Author: carlalang
Reviews.Content: nice hotel some people may not like the black gray decor (modern theme I guess) but over all hotel is clean, great location, and for me great price (about 80 $/ night) i did rebook the room right before i arrived for a cheaper rate. not fancy but perfect me!

Reviews.Title: “Very very central”
Reviews.Author: MariMalta82
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, just round the corner from the Ramblas, placa real and 5 mins away from the metro stop. The promenade and MareMagnum are also at walking distance. The rooms are clean and most of the staff is helpful and efficient. The only problem with the rooms is that most of them don't have a window facing outside. I was there in summer and the room was sometimes stuffy even though there was the a/c. The only window overlooked the corridor therefore there was no proper ventilation. When i went back in December I was given the same room and only after complaining to a number of receptionists was I given another room with a small balcony which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel we have ever had the misfortune to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Bill164
Reviews.Content: Depressing hotel with black and grey colour scheme; floors are painted concrete and sticky underfoot. Rooms are small with beds pushed up against walls so only one of you can get out. No wardrobes, only metal framework, and no drawers. We had to change rooms three times - the first room we were offered was a single room with a double bed in it - very claustrophobic, and no window. Dining room for breakfast was in the basement, also painted black and grey with unfriendly feel, and with a very poor range of food. This stay felt like a punishment not a city break. The only good thing was the location, close to Las Ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good design”
Reviews.Author: corregedor
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a few steps of distance from Ramblas, with a lot os bars, that make the interior room a little bit noisy. It's a really a nice design hotel, very clean, with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: groovyboothy
Reviews.Content: Just returned back to the UK from a 3 nights stay at this lovely hotel, great location just 2 streets away from La Ramblas. Spotlessley clean with good aircon which is a bonus in 35 degrees heat. Arrived at 11pm on Friday night with a warm welcome from Oscar on Reception who had all the answers to our questions. We found La Ramblas very touristy but worth a visit just the once, the surrounding areas of Barcelona much more interesting.In the evening visited the Gothic and El Born areas for tapas and bars, only a 5 minute walk away. If we visit Barcelona again we will definately stay at this hotel, highly recommended as very central and close to all bars, shops and boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, good location, kinda small.”
Reviews.Author: tuohyj
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to everything. Very centrally located. Rooms very small. It did have a pool however it was the size of a bath. No area for sunbathing. Website when booking hotel did not seem secure as pin numbers were printed on reservation upon our arrival. No desire to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room without view/window”
Reviews.Author: Alexar0undthew0rld
Reviews.Content: We were shocked to find out that our room did not have a window at all. I tried to change into another room, but they only had more windowless rooms available. We tried it for 1 night but we slept very poor due to bad air circulation, loud noises in the lobby and very uncomfortable mattrasses. Luckily they allowed us to cancel our booking for the 2nd night and found another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: nelitodasilva
Reviews.Content: simple, modern, nice decor but cheap materials and finishings... good location, friendly, nice staff. free wifi works fine! if i found good promotion i will stay there again, but rack rates are not justified...

Reviews.Title: “Good design hotel in an excellent location, perfect for a citytrip”
Reviews.Author: geerard78
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with design rooms. Hotel is from walking distance from Ramlas, and the side streets near the hotel hold some excellent tapas bars. Good value for money, and perfect for a citytrip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: neoMag1c
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the roots of Barcelona, stay in this hotel! You almost can't get any closer to the old city centre. It is close to the Ramblas, the Gothic area and near to a few metro stations. Unfortunately, the beds in the hotel are not very soft at all and the rooms are not isolated very well and therefore quite noisy... The hotel personnel is ok, but I've met people that are more friendly. By the way: ask for a room with a window on the outside!

Reviews.Title: “perfect value for money”
Reviews.Author: gelless
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the last weekend of november. the stuff was very helpfull and allways with a smile. the locatin was the best you can get. very good breakfast(10 euro in the hotel). the room is more then satisfied(lcd, big bathroom with 24/7 hot water).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MattCSenior
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in November and although the interior looks plush, it has no charm. We were allocated a ground floor room, that had no windows whatsoever and the most uncomfortable beds (rock hard mattress) I have ever encountered. The central location is its redeeming feature, located 2 minutes from the Ramblas. However it is not a place you would want to lose direction once it gets dark. Breakfast was plentiful but was additional to the room charge and so we went elsewhere the next day. Not great value for money for the time of year, you are paying for the location and very little else!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Vbackpacker
Reviews.Content: Rooftop pool and Spa for a Bargain Price! Great rooms, clean with everything you need. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great Location, right in the heart of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not much more”
Reviews.Author: MikeJohnson_STM
Reviews.Content: The clever modern design is a nice touch, and the room decor is interesting, but all in all not terribly impressed. We got one of the windowless rooms, and while the wall-size photo of a harbor was nice it did little to give us any impression whatsoever of when it was morning, especially slightly jet-lagged. Staff ranged from pleasant and helpful to downright rude, the latter hanging on a personal phone call for over five minutes while two guests stood at the front desk looking to set up wake-up calls. Didn't do much at the hotel but sleep, so can't quite report on most of the other amenities. Cleanliness was fine. Location was fantastic, right on d'Avinyo a 30-second walk from Ferran but in a quiet spot. Unpleasantly firm beds (and I prefer firm) in the typical two-twins-pushed-together-make-a-double arrangement. Has no-fuss wifi; had a difficult time picking it up in our room, though it was strong in the lobby. All in all a great base of operations but if you're looking to feel special keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good all round stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetasyourdreams
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Barcelona at the beginning of the music festival, which was absolutely brilliant! This hotel was just far enough away to be peaceful, even though it's a very central location, you really don't want to be staying anywhere but centrally. The reception staff were extremely calm, friendly and very helpful. Our room was huge but faced the inside of the building, which suited us because we are light sleepers and don't like noise. The bathroom was lovely and everything was spotlessly clean. We didn't have breakfast here, as there are plenty of places to go but we bought ham, cheese and peaches from the little supermarket and a baguette from the bakery round the corner. The pool is absolutely tiny but it's better than none at all, the jacuzzi is definitely worth taking a bathing costume for. All in all, we had a pleasant, relaxing stay here and would definitely go back, especially during the music festival. It really is cheaper to book your hotel online, even if you're already in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: MalikPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We have just had 4 nights at this hotel and would definatley recommend it. Very minimalist style. We had a decent '3-bed' room with a window and balcony overlooking the street. The room had a well-stocked mini-bar (although quite steep in price), plasma TV, phone and a safe. Nice en-suite well-equippped bathroom too. Within easy walking distance to Las Ramblas. We didnt have the breakfast at the hotel but some great little cafes and places to eat nearby. Also some nice bars. Hotel also has own bar area. Bit of noise on street at night with passers-by but not too bad. Didnt use the roof-top swimming pool/sauna as were unlucky with the weather but looked nice. Would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Everything A Single Traveler Would Need”
Reviews.Author: frank_379
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, staff was helpful and friendly. Room was not as small as other reviews put them, but is small, but efficiant. Room came with Plasma TV, safe, desk, and storage space. The bathroom was very clean and roomy. Maids were clean and kind. Mini bar was nice and there is also a vending machine on the first floor. Breakfast was worth the 10 euros if your a breakfast person, and the price is 10 euros at the hotel! Neighborhood was great during the day, but in the we hours of the morning you need to take precautions anywhere in the world. The hotel is a 5 min walk to the Rablas, Licue, and Jaume station. Best of all I left my labtop in the taxi and I called the desk clerk at the hotel and he called the taxi company for me. The cab driver met me a terminal 3 to bring me my computer. Great hotel, great location , and great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MerseysideJenny
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were a bit apprehensive about staying there. Well we needn't have been. The hotel is 5 mins from the Ramblas down a little street (not an alleyway as one review stated). The staff are friendly and always greeted you when seeing you. They looked after our lugguage on the day of departure free of charge! Our rooms were serviced every day and the towels were changed every day. The air conditioning was excellent and you could leave it on all day whilst you were out so the room was super cool on your return. Our room had a window to the outside but my daughter's window faced inwards but even so her room was not stuffy at all. (I had requested rooms with windows) after I realised some didn't have them after reading some reviews after I had booked the hotel. We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and we will definately go back. We cannot comment on breakfast as this was extra and we found a lovely pattisserie down the road that we visited every morning! The pool is on the small side but the roof patio is lovely to relax in for an hour or so after a day's sightseeing and is a great sun trap. On several evenings you could here someone nearby playing piano music professionally!! The Blundell family from St Helens Merseyside.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: tcmshopping
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, near Ramblas but no noise in hotel at night. Rooms spacious and spotless, swimming pool small but good, great value. Only drawback is no windows in some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Find something else”
Reviews.Author: empiroParis
Reviews.Content: Hotel overall clean and design, with a good location but most of the room have no outdoors windows and therefore always in the dark. Bathroom was clean but not very practical. This hotel is not worth the price and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Location!”
Reviews.Author: AmieLondon
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel, the street it's on 'Avinyo' is long and narrow, and full of great bars, shops and restaurants. It's also a 2 minute walk from Las Ramblas and the waterfront, so really well situated. After reading other reveiws on Trip Advisor, I made a special; request for a room on a higher floor with a window. We were on the 5th floor, and had a window that opened onto a side street. It was faintly noisy at night, but it didn't really bother me, as the location more than makes up for it. The 'Gothic Quarter' is definately where you want to be, with winding streets and courtyards. The customer service wasn't great, but I don't pick hotels for the service, so that wasn't an issue for me. We dodn't have brealfast at the hotel, as there are great places further down the street. It was also great to have to the pool on the roof terrace for a quick swim after a hot day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly but the room didn't impress much”
Reviews.Author: jennyjupiter
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of reviews on TripAdvisor for a number of hotels before choosing this one. Thus when making the reservation I requested a room on the 5th floor with a window. They were booked up on that floor so I took one on the 4th floor instead. The problem is they only have double rooms with windows to the outside. If you're in a designated single room (as I was), you'll have a window looking onto the atrium corridoor. It isn't terribly bad, but the windows don't open and the rooms don't get much air, which I think they make up for with scented air freshener which I found quite overwhelming. The plus side is that if you have one of these rooms on the atrium at the top of the building, you have no street noise and can't hear much so if you need a place that you'll get a good sleep in, I can confirm this worked for me. Apart from the whole lack of window/stuffiness issue, I found the room clean, simple and comfortable and got a really good wireless connection from there. The pool and spa on the roof is small but a lovely way to refresh after a hot day out in Barcelona. I walked here from the airport bus with my bags and it took 15 minutes, its so central you wouldn't believe it. Nice restaurants around in the streets nearby. The staff were really nice to me, but I was speaking Spanish, I'm not sure how they react to English only. I'm glad I picked this place for its price for the two nights I was here, but I'll definitely stay somewhere else next time, just because I can't stand sleeping somewhere without a window that opens for fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central and compact but ask to be on a higher floor”
Reviews.Author: moosnorthampton
Reviews.Content: We, five of us, stayed for three nights and had a pleasant stay. The kids enjoyed the jaccuzzi and the space to lounge on the roof. The rooms were clean and adequate, good wall sized photos, all furnishings in our rooms were black, grey, white and chrome and appeared newish - the style was very modern and minimalist. We had agreed a third bed be put in the twin room for one of the boys - this was not done before our arrival but the man on reception who dealt with us was very embarrassed about this and sorted the problem immediately. The rooms were quiet and light and although our view was of a building the other side of an alley the second room had a small balcony and faced the main street - we had asked to be on a higher floor as some of the lower rooms can be dark. I thought the location was great, the facade understated, the rooms were functional and smallish but there was hanging space, ( no draws ) and a table. The hotel staff were pleasant but we didn't really ask them for much. All in all a good stay as we did not want to spend much time in our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but clean, modern and great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie082
Reviews.Content: From the other reviews here i was expecting a hostel, in actual fact the hotel although tucked away down a back street is very modern and clean. Right in the middle of La Ramblas, this is a good palce if you dont want to hang around the hotel. Breakfast at 15€ is a rip off Room very modern and clean, but oh my word can they be stuffy (many do not face to the outside and so have no natural light). Not easy to find, but i will help! The bus takes you direct from the airport to the top of La Ramblas (a wide boulevarde the 'rambles' down to the harbour/sea front). Walsk down la Ramblas until you come to a junction with a Mc Donalds AND KFC together. Turn left, walk 200 m and Avinyo Road/Alley is on the right. if you want an EXTREMELY good value restaurant (when did you last see people 20 deep queuing to get in a restaurant?) try the set menu at La Fonda

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: orion22
Reviews.Content: Pros: amazingly done up big rooms, with bigger bathrooms, spotlessly clean, friendly staff, great location Cons: you'd rather have breakfast at one of the cafes around the corner, really disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: IrelandFemale
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights. On arrival i offered to pay in advance so that if anything happened my bill would be covered, they seemed to be disapointed that i was paying in cash!!! The hotel room was clean but dark because of the room location 003 if we opened our curtains we were looking out on the lobby, therefore we had no privacy and if felt like we were hiding from someone. Both nights we were in bed before midnight because we did alot during the day and had early starts in the mornings because of our room location the noise levels were really high and we found it hard to go to sleep and to sleep through the night without been woken by noise. There didnt seem to be a high level of security at the hotel and often i heard banging on doors and windows which made me insecure when going to sleep. The hotel was reasonably priced and it reflected in their service, i definately would not recommend it for older couples or a girls weekend. There was also a huge street construction going on straight at the hotel door which we were never notified about and caused alot of noise and dust.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel at all , would certainly go back”
Reviews.Author: dellas1000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I wanted something at the lower end of the Ramblas Street. I read the reviews on here and was a bit worried. I decided to stick with it and Im really glad I did. I was allocated room 512 and it had a window looking out to the street. The room was modern,bright and clean and the bathroom was lovely with a nice jet hot shower. Flat screen TV with BBC News 24 and Sky News channels. Also Spanish and Italian channels. The staff were friendly and I have to say I enjoyed my stay. The surrounding area could be seen by some as run down but it certainly is not un safe. They are laying a new pavement ( sidewalk) so it should add to the clean up. The big bonus for me here was FREE WIFI internet 24/7 . I got 90-100% signals in most parts of the hotel. Also the rooftop swimming pool and jaquzzi are really nice with nice views over the city. I have to say I will certainly be going back to this hotel in future. I will add my photos later One thing about another comment about noise from the bar. I can see how this could affect people in the rooms around this area but I would suggest emailing the hotel maybe 3-4 days before and requesting a room on the 5th floor with an outside view.

Reviews.Title: “Book with caution!”
Reviews.Author: mitchells
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location - near to La Rambla and plenty of restaurants and bars nearby - however it is a slightly rough area which could be a problem if you arrive late at night or are a group of girls. Unfortunately we were allocated a room right by the bar - with no outside window or window that could be opened or curtains drawn so it was a bit like staying in a cupboard - the room was clean with a new trendy style bathroom - but the actual room 001 was a bit scruffy and knocked about. When we requested a room change we were told by the very unhelpful reception staff no way that they were full so we had to put up with the room for 2 nights - a very unpleasant experience. IF YOU BOOK THIS HOTEL ENSURE YOU REQUEST A ROOM WITH AN OUTSIDE WINDOW.

Reviews.Title: “Think again...”
Reviews.Author: wireyj
Reviews.Content: Clean but very small... Lovely staff but don't know much about their own area so you have to figure places out for yourself... Jacuzzi bigger than swimming pool! Any fans of stargate - hotel room corridors are similar to the base! Same colour throughout all the floors with huge numbers printed on the doors... Rooms are tiny. Be careful also who you book with as we booked with an online agency and our 'secure' credit details were on show!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cazmerc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best for location. it is just off Las Rambles. 20 min walk to beach south and 20 mins walk to where the bus drops you off from airport north. There are loads of irish bars within a few minutes. The clubbing area is in Port Olympic which is about 30 min walk away but to be honest we found the bars open until 4am which is late enough cos there is so much sight seeing to do during the day. The hotel is basic and clean with nice breakfast. However, the room we had had a window overlooking the dark corridor (that did not open). It had Air con but not sufficient. We had ours on 24/7 and it was still hot and stuffy in there. The bathroom had no ventilation. A taxi from the airport cost 50 euros while the Aerobus cos 4 euros each!!!! It's the A1 bus right outside the airport. We were very careful with our belongings and had no problem at all and late at night use to walk the long way home (about 5 minutes instead of 2), so just use your head and keep your wits about you. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: bronsters
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is fantastic - just a few minutes walk to Las Ramblas and the port, surrounded by loads of restaurant options and shops. The pool on the roof is also great - not large, but perfect for cooling off at the end of the day, and grabbing a few rays during the day. Unfortunately a few things let down the experience.... I had booked a double room, and was told that they had overbooked and I would have to take a single room - not a good outcome at the best of time, but worst when you've just had a break-up! With a lot of pushing they offered a free beakfast as compensation for the price difference, and the offer to move to a double room the next day. The room they gave me had no external windows, and looked over the internal closed in courtyard. When I was moved to a new room on the second day, although a double, the only window actually overlooked the hallway. So no natural light in my rooms for the 2 day stay - felt like a bit of a dungeon! This seemed to apply to all the rooms on the ground and first floors. Although it seems that rooms above this level do have windows to the outside world. The rooms were new and styled nicely, but very small, even the double. I wouldnt stay there again unless I could be guaranteed a room with a proper window.

Reviews.Title: “resonable stay”
Reviews.Author: dokyjun
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 3 day weekend trip to barcelona, i hope this review will help you. I picked this hotel because of the location and the black and white pictures on the wall. Well the room is as it looks on the websites, you just have to realize that the rooms are small. I will tell you the pros: Location ( close to las ramblas and other places, and also close to water front and train station) i walked from train station to hotel and only took me 10 minutes. Breakfast is included and it was very delicious with good variety. Cons: although bathroom was clean, there was meldew on the bath tiles and the drain did not work so there was a big puddle. After letting the front desk know, this was fixed the next day. The pool on the roof is very small, i would not even mention it, and the jacuzzi was broke the day i got there. Overall, i don't spend much time in hotels and the location interested me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Royace
Reviews.Content: Just had 4 days in barcelona and stayed at the Catalonia Avinyo just off the Ramblas. Read the reviews and was'nt sure about booking this hotel. This surely was'nt the same hotel trippers were griping about. But we booked it and were not dissapointed. Staff were very polite, rooms were clean and adequate with a free safe and a well stocked mini bar. breakfast was a treat with plenty of choice, also a nice roof terrace with good sunbeds and table and chairs. We went with another couple and they agreed with us, 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ANIGIE
Reviews.Content: I was pessimistic before arriving at Hotel Avinyo due to negative reports I had read. I found it to be a very functional and extremely central location. The rooms are small but ours were clean, we had plenty hot water, they were dark, (fantastic) and no traffic or outside noise distractions, so sleep wasn't a problem. The breakfast wasn't great but we had enough to eat none the less. Everything was cold but we were always the end of the queue anyway! Staff were pleasant not overfriendly but had no problems with them. The hotel itself is like an upgraded hostel, its void of atmosphere but basic and functional. The bar is usually empty, restaurant tables that are never used (we guessed they are for ornamental purposes). There if free internet (3 laptops) a big plus for teenagers, and we had one in our group, so big thumbs up to that. Overall, I would recommend the Hotel to others, like all holidays, we used it little, just for a base and the location in perfect, action on the doorstep and thats what makes a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “good value....”
Reviews.Author: busgeezer1965
Reviews.Content: My brother in law and I stayed here last week.We were over to see the football.The hotel room was dark, but who cares.It was clean and lets be honest ,you ain't paying 5Star are you?It was handy for the Ramblas, the beach and the Cathedral.I have read reviews saying the front counter staff wern't so good.It must have been a different set of guys we met.They went out of their way to get us a map and mark out which subway we should use,the porter also offered to get us tickets for the game.(we already had some).We never made breakfast but there are sandwich shops etc. nearby.All in all a good choice
